title: Chip Makers Stockpiled Key Materials Ahead of Russian Invasion of Ukraine
sub_head: The global semiconductor industry, already stretched, secured needed neon and palladium, but long-term risks remain
body:
Almost two years of chip shortages, a result of surging demand and extreme supply-chain disruptions during the pandemic, have had an unexpected upside for the semiconductor industry, preparing it to manage the turmoil caused by Russiaâ€™s invasion of Ukraine.
Production of vital raw materials for chip making is concentrated in Russia and Ukraine. The countries are a major source of both neon gas, needed to feed lasers that print minute circuitry onto silicon, and the metal palladium used in later manufacturing stages.
